title: TikTok users can't upload anti-ICE videos. The company blames tech issues
summary:
TikTok users are reporting difficulties uploading videos critical of Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), particularly following the fatal shooting of Alex Pretti by a federal agent. Comedian Megan Stalter and nurse Jen Hamilton, among others, experienced repeated failures when attempting to post anti-ICE content, with Stalter ultimately deleting her account, suspecting censorship.

TikTok attributes these upload issues to technical glitches stemming from a power outage at a US data center, stating they are "unrelated" to recent events or content. However, this explanation is met with skepticism, especially given recent changes in TikTok's US ownership. A majority American-owned joint venture, including Oracle (whose executive chair has ties to the Trump administration), recently took control of the platform’s US operations, overseeing content moderation and user data.

Experts like Professor Casey Fiesler note a "significant lack of trust" in social media platforms, exacerbated by TikTok's new leadership and its perceived connections to the government, particularly regarding ICE. While proving intentional censorship is difficult due to TikTok’s opaque algorithm, the perception itself is eroding user trust. Jeffrey Blevins, a media law expert, clarifies that as a private platform, TikTok legally can moderate content.

The controversy has led to a surge in TikTok uninstalls, with some users seeking alternative platforms. Others, like Jen Hamilton, are adapting by using "coded" language to discuss sensitive topics, believing the obstacles are designed to silence narratives contrary to government interests. The situation underscores broader concerns about content moderation, data privacy, and free speech on major social media platforms under new ownership.
chinese_title: 抖音用户无法上传反ICE视频。该公司归咎于技术问题。
chinese_summary:
TikTok用户报告称，在联邦特工枪杀亚历克斯·普雷蒂（Alex Pretti）事件后，他们上传批评移民和海关执法局（ICE）的视频时遇到了困难。喜剧演员梅根·斯塔尔特（Megan Stalter）和护士珍·汉密尔顿（Jen Hamilton）等人，在尝试发布反ICE内容时反复失败，斯塔尔特最终删除了她的账户，怀疑遭到审查。

TikTok将这些上传问题归咎于美国数据中心停电导致的技术故障，并声明这些问题与近期事件或内容“无关”。然而，这一解释遭到了质疑，尤其是考虑到TikTok在美国的所有权近期发生了变化。一个由多数美国公司持股的合资企业，其中包括甲骨文公司（其执行董事长与特朗普政府有联系），最近接管了该平台在美国的运营，负责监督内容审核和用户数据。

凯西·菲斯勒（Casey Fiesler）教授等专家指出，人们对社交媒体平台“严重缺乏信任”，而TikTok的新领导层及其与政府（特别是ICE）的关联，加剧了这种不信任感。尽管由于TikTok不透明的算法，很难证明存在蓄意审查，但这种看法本身正在侵蚀用户信任。媒体法专家杰弗里·布莱文斯（Jeffrey Blevins）澄清说，作为私人平台，TikTok在法律上可以审核内容。

这场争议导致TikTok卸载量激增，一些用户正在寻找替代平台。另一些人，如珍·汉密尔顿，则通过使用“暗语”讨论敏感话题来适应，他们认为这些障碍旨在压制与政府利益相悖的叙事。这一局面凸显了在新所有权下，主要社交媒体平台在内容审核、数据隐私和言论自由方面存在的更广泛担忧。

title: France Aiming to Replace Zoom, Google Meet, Microsoft Teams, etc.
summary:
The provided content is not an article about France's efforts to replace video conferencing tools, as suggested by the title.

Instead, it is a system message or error notification from x.com (formerly Twitter). The message informs the user that JavaScript is disabled in their browser and instructs them to enable JavaScript or switch to a supported browser to continue using the x.com platform.

The text also includes standard website footer links such as Help Center, Terms of Service, Privacy Policy, Cookie Policy, Imprint, and Ad information, along with a copyright notice for © 2026 X Corp.
chinese_title: 法国欲取代Zoom、Google Meet、Microsoft Teams等
chinese_summary: 所提供的内容并非一篇如标题所示的关于法国努力替换视频会议工具的文章。相反，它是一条来自 x.com（前身为 Twitter）的系统消息或错误通知。该消息告知用户其浏览器中已禁用 JavaScript，并指示他们启用 JavaScript 或切换到受支持的浏览器，以继续使用 x.com 平台。该文本还包括标准的网站页脚链接，例如“帮助中心”、“服务条款”、“隐私政策”、“Cookie 政策”、“版本说明”和“广告信息”，以及 © 2026 X 公司 的版权声明。

title: Over 36,500 killed in Iran's deadliest massacre, documents reveal
summary: Documents reviewed by Iran International's Editorial Board reveal that over 36,500 Iranians were killed by security forces during a crackdown on nationwide protests on January 8-9. This event is described as the deadliest two-day protest massacre in history.
chinese_title: 文件披露：伊朗最致命大屠杀逾36,500人遇害
chinese_summary: 《伊朗国际》编辑委员会审阅的文件显示，在1月8日至9日镇压全国性抗议活动期间，超过36,500名伊朗人被安全部队杀害。此次事件被描述为历史上最致命的两天抗议大屠杀。

title: After two years of vibecoding, I'm back to writing by hand
summary:
The author reflects on two years of "vibecoding," a term describing a period of intense, often superficial, digital output driven by a culture valuing speed and quantity over quality. This involved rapidly generating notes, articles, and code, akin to "shitting out" digital content to capture fleeting ideas or "vibes." The author found this process led to burnout, a sense of disconnect, and work that felt insubstantial and easily forgotten, like "sand in my hands."

After experiencing the shallowness and lack of permanence in this digital deluge, the author made a conscious return to writing by hand. This shift is presented as an antidote to the perceived drawbacks of "vibecoding." Handwriting, for the author, is an embodied, slow, and deliberate process that forces deeper thought and clarity. It connects the mind to the body, making ideas feel more "real" and "sticky."

Using tools like Lamy Safaris with fine nibs and Midori MD Notebooks, the author finds that handwriting fosters a more profound connection to their work, leading to higher quality output and a renewed sense of purpose. It allows for a slower, more intentional engagement with ideas, creating tangible artifacts that contrast with the fleeting nature of digital notes. While not abandoning digital tools entirely, handwriting has become the primary method for initial thought generation and drafting, enabling a deeper interface with their "inner world" and reclaiming intellectual autonomy from the pressures of digital productivity.
chinese_title: 写了两年代码之后，我又开始手写了。
chinese_summary:
作者反思了两年“情绪编码”（vibecoding）的经历，这个词描述的是在一种看重速度和数量而非质量的文化驱动下，进行着大量、往往肤浅的数字内容产出的时期。这包括快速生成笔记、文章和代码，就像“排泄般倾泻”数字内容以捕捉转瞬即逝的想法或“情绪/灵感”。作者发现这个过程导致了倦怠、疏离感，以及像“手里的沙子”一样，感觉空洞且容易被遗忘的作品。

在经历了这场数字洪流的肤浅和缺乏持久性之后，作者有意识地回归了手写。这种转变被视为“情绪编码”所带来弊端的解药。对手写而言，手写是一个具身化、缓慢而深思熟虑的过程，它迫使作者进行更深入的思考，获得更清晰的理解。它将思想与身体连接起来，让想法感觉更“真实”和“更具粘性”。

通过使用如Lamy Safari钢笔（细尖）和Midori MD笔记本等工具，作者发现手写能培养与工作更深刻的联系，从而产生更高质量的产出和重塑的使命感。它允许以更缓慢、更有意的方式与思想互动，创造出有形的产物，这与数字笔记转瞬即逝的特性形成对比。尽管没有完全放弃数字工具，手写已成为作者初步构思和起草的主要方法，使其能够更深入地与“内心世界”进行交互，并从数字生产力的压力中收回智力自主权。

title: First, make me care
summary: This writing advice emphasizes the importance of a compelling opening in nonfiction. Many pieces fail to engage readers because they begin with background information rather than a hook. To prevent readers from disengaging, writers should identify the most interesting anomaly or question related to their topic and lead with that. By capturing attention first, the writer earns the right to present background details, ensuring readers stay to discover the "good material."
chinese_title: 先让我关注
chinese_summary: 这条写作建议强调了非虚构作品中引人入胜的开头的重要性。许多作品未能吸引读者，因为它们以背景信息开头，而非引子。为防止读者失去兴趣，作者应找出与主题相关的最有趣的异常现象或问题，并以此作为开篇。通过首先抓住读者注意力，作者便赢得了呈现背景细节的权利，从而确保读者会留下来探寻“精彩内容”。

title: Yes, It's Fascism
summary:
The author, initially hesitant to label President Trump and the MAGA movement as "fascist" due to the term's overuse and ill-definition, now asserts it is the most accurate description. Previously, the author characterized Trump's governing style as "patrimonialism"—treating the state as personal property—but now identifies a more sinister shift towards doctrinal and operational fascism. This conclusion stems not from isolated incidents but from a "constellation of characteristics" that, viewed together, reveal a clear pattern.

These characteristics include: the deliberate demolition of civic norms and liberal pieties to unleash "dark passions"; the glorification of violence, praising mobs, and endorsing torture; the belief that "might is right," asserting the strong dominate the weak; the politicization of law enforcement to persecute enemies and shield allies, rejecting due process; the dehumanization of opponents and immigrants with language akin to the Third Reich; the deployment of police-state tactics through agencies like ICE, expanding their power and encouraging brutality; efforts to undermine elections and a refusal to accept defeat; the commandeering of private entities, blurring public and private sectors; relentless attacks on news media, labeling them "enemies of the people"; predatory territorial and military aggression, disrespecting international law; transnational support for authoritarian regimes globally; and the promotion of a "blood-and-soil" nationalism, explicitly favoring a whiter, more Christian America and rejecting birthright citizenship. The author concludes that this totality of actions demonstrates a governing model consistent with fascism.
chinese_title: 是的，这就是法西斯主义。
chinese_summary:
作者起初因“法西斯”一词被滥用且定义模糊而迟疑，不愿将特朗普总统和“让美国再次伟大”运动贴上“法西斯”的标签，但现在断言这是最准确的描述。此前，作者曾将特朗普的执政风格描述为“家产制”（即将国家视为私人财产），但现在发现了更险恶的转变，即转向了教条化和操作性的法西斯主义。这一结论并非源于孤立事件，而是源于一系列特征的集合，这些特征综合起来，揭示出一个清晰的模式。

这些特征包括：蓄意破坏公民规范和自由主义信条，以释放“黑暗的激情”；颂扬暴力，赞扬暴徒，认可酷刑；相信“强权即公理”，宣称强者主宰弱者；将执法政治化，以迫害敌人和庇护盟友，拒绝正当程序；使用类似于第三帝国（纳粹德国）的语言对对手和移民进行非人化对待；通过移民和海关执法局（ICE）等机构部署警察国家手段，扩大其权力并鼓励残暴行为；破坏选举的努力以及拒绝接受失败；征用私营实体，模糊公共和私人部门界限；对新闻媒体进行无情攻击，将其诬蔑为“人民的敌人”；掠夺性领土和军事侵略，无视国际法；在全球范围内跨国支持威权政权；以及宣扬“血与土”的民族主义，明确偏袒一个更白人化、更基督教化的美国，并拒绝出生公民权。作者总结道，所有这些行动共同表明了一种与法西斯主义相符的执政模式。

title: Television is 100 years old today
summary:
Today, January 26, 2026, marks the 100th anniversary of television's first public demonstration by Scottish inventor John Logie Baird. While early experiments occurred elsewhere, notably in Hastings where Baird built his first transmitter using household items and achieved the first image (a St Johns Ambulance medal shadow) in 1923, the decisive moment was in London.

In November 1924, Baird moved to 22 Frith Street, Soho, setting up a workshop above an Italian cafe. After demonstrating his electro-mechanical "Televisor" at Selfridges, he honed his process. By October 1925, he transmitted images with gradations of light and shade, famously using a dummy "Stooky Bill" and then, 20-year-old William Taynton, who became the first human subject to be televised.

The official demonstration to the press and Royal Institution members took place on January 26, 1926, at Frith Street, showcasing the dummy and then transmitted human faces. Although many present didn't grasp its significance, The Times reported on Baird's invention.

Baird continued innovating, developing colour television, stereoscopic (3D) TV, and infra-red TV by 1928. He initiated experimental BBC transmissions in 1930. However, when broadcast television launched in 1936, his mechanical system competed with Marconi-EMI's superior electronic system and was dropped after three months.

Despite his star waning due to competition and wartime disruptions, Baird is remembered for making television possible. Today, 22 Frith Street, now Bar Italia, is recognized with plaques as a "World Origin Site" for live television, celebrating Baird's pioneering contribution that led to television becoming a transformative invention of the 20th century.
chinese_title: 电视今天一百岁了
chinese_summary:
今天，即2026年1月26日，是苏格兰发明家约翰·洛吉·贝尔德首次公开演示电视的100周年纪念日。尽管早期的实验在其他地方进行，尤其是在黑斯廷斯，贝尔德于1923年使用家居用品制造了他的第一个发射器并实现了第一张图像（圣约翰救护车奖章的阴影），但决定性时刻发生在伦敦。

1924年11月，贝尔德搬到苏荷区弗里斯街22号，在一家意大利咖啡馆楼上设立了工作室。在塞尔福里奇百货公司演示了他的机电式“电视机”（Televisor）后，他完善了自己的技术。到1925年10月，他成功传输了具有明暗渐变的图像，其中最著名的是使用了假人“Stooky Bill”，随后是20岁的威廉·泰恩顿，他成为第一个被电视直播的人。

1926年1月26日，在弗里斯街，贝尔德向新闻界和皇家研究院成员进行了官方演示，展示了假人，随后传输了人脸图像。尽管当时在场的许多人没有完全领会其重要性，《泰晤士报》仍对贝尔德的发明进行了报道。

贝尔德继续创新，到1928年开发出了彩色电视、立体（3D）电视和红外电视。他于1930年启动了BBC的实验性电视传输。然而，当广播电视于1936年推出时，他的机械系统与马可尼-EMI更优越的电子系统展开竞争，并在三个月后被淘汰。

尽管由于竞争和战时中断，贝尔德的光芒逐渐减弱，但他因使电视成为可能而被铭记。今天，弗里斯街22号，即现在的意大利酒吧（Bar Italia），被授予牌匾，作为电视直播的“世界起源地”，以纪念贝尔德的开创性贡献，正是他的贡献使电视成为20世纪一项具有变革意义的发明。
